Keywords

Battle Icon

  1. So on Spare Parts it says after each battle you may swap 1 card from your hand with one of your flipped green pip cards, is this just a printing of the base rule, or a card effect that lets you swap out a second green pip?
    That’s just reminder text for anyone who may have forgotten how the green battle icons work.
  2. What does ‘each battle’ entail regarding green icons? For example, if my opponent has 3 attacks on my one character, every time I flip a green battle icon for each individual battle that turn, I can add one green icon for each battle, totaling 3?
    Yes. You can get one green battle icon per battle.
  3. Hello. I have a question about green pips and turns with multiple attacks. When does the card exchange happen? After each attack? After all attacks are resolved? If it is after all attacks are resolved, do you only exchange for one card, or do you exchange for each attack? In the rules it used the term battle and I was not sure if that meant each attack or all attacks.
    You can swap for a green battle icon card after each attack has finished. If there are multiple attacks in a turn, you can swap for one green battle icon card after each of those attacks, I.E. attack, swap, attack, swap, and so on.
  4. Why are there tiny icons on the Battle Icons?
    Hybrid icons, introduced in When Icons Combine are new with Wave 5. They consist of a Trait icon on top of a Battle Icon, and only a character with that Trait receive the benefit of the icon colour when flipping in a battle. For example a Car icon on top of a Green pip would allow only a character in Car form (i.e. showing a Car trait) to swap that card at the end of a battle.
  5. Which cards have Hybrid Battle Icons?
    The following cards have hybrid battle icons:
    - Concealing Contrails (Plane)
    - Hand-To-Hand Combar (Melee)
    - Headbutt (Titan Master)
    - Hull Down (Tank)
    - Lock on Target (Plane)
    - Master of Metallikato (Specialist/Ranged/Melee)
    - Nitro Booster (Car)
    - Paralyzo Box (Ranged)
    - Spymaster's Ruse (Specialist)
  6. Does Inverted! supersede other effects that look at pips? Or can the order be chosen? For example, Inverted! with Thermal Weaponry, could a blue pip add to pierce before changing into an orange pip?
    Battle icon colors do not exist simultaneously. When Battle Icons are made to change colors, it happens instantaneously.
  7. What is a Green Battle Icon?
    This set introduces a new battle icon: green! Here’s how it works. After a battle in which you
    flipped at least one card with a green battle icon, you may swap a card in your hand with one of
    the cards you flipped with a green battle icon. The card you swap from your hand will be
    scrapped at the end of the turn, along with all the other cards you played or flipped during the
    turn.
  8. I flipped 2 cards with green battle icons. Can I return both of them to my hand by swapping
    two cards?
    No. Only one card with a green battle icon per battle.
  9. If both players flip a card with a green battle icon, who decides first?
    The player whose turn it is goes first, then the other player.
  10. What is a Black Battle Icon?
    There’s a new battle icon on some battle cards in War for Cybertron: Siege I. It’s black! What
    does it mean? If you’re on the attack, hopefully good things for you.
    For each black battle icon you flip while attacking, your character gets pierce 1 until end of turn.
    Remember that pierce numbers add up, so flipping two black icons in an attack will give your
    attacker pierce 2, and so on.
  11. Do black battle icons have any effect on a character that’s defending?
    No. Black battle icons flipped on defense won’t give your character pierce. (And pierce
    doesn’t work on defense anyway.)
  12. Let's say that my opponent has 1 single untapped character with 2 defense. It is my turn and I have 2 or 3 characters, so I will attack multiple times. During my first attack my opponent flipped 1 or 2 blue icons. The question is: During my second attack, my opponent's character will start the battling with 2 defense or with 4 defense? Also, the same may happen with the orange icon if I got a way to attack twice with the same player in a turn?
    The Battle Icons you flip are only effective for that individual battle. Attack and Defense increases will not carry over.
  13. What is a 'Battle Icon'?
    An oblong of colour in the right hand corner of a battle card.
  14. What is a 'blue battle icon'?
    A blue oblong in the right hand corner of a battle card.
    "The defender gets +1 defense for each blue battle icon you flip when attacking."
  15. What is an 'orange battle icon'?
    An orange oblong in the right hand corner of a battle card.
    "The attacker gets +1 attack for each orange battle icon you flip when attacking."
  16. What is a 'white battle icon'?
    An white oblong in the right hand corner of a battle card.
    When attacking or defending, the first white battle icon flipped means the player flips two more battle cards. Additional white icons do not lead to more battle cards being flipped unless an effect explicitly states it does.
  17. Question about green battle icons and how the work. The text on a card with a green icon says "After a battle, you swap a card from your hand with a green icon you flipped" does this mean since Swarm makes you flip the battle cards. Can you grab a green icon you flipped for Swarm after you battle?
    No, only cards with green battle icons that you flipped during that battle can be retrieved after the battle.
